Title: Migrate to SnakeYAML Engine
Comment Messages: ["-1 obviously, you can't turn off this check for binary compatibility. ", 'it is binary incompatible', '@garydgregory can you please suggest the way to continue ?', "Yes: Don't change that setting. You cannot break binary compatibility (BC) outside of a major release upgrade. If this PR breaks BC, then it's -1.\r\n\r\nGary", '@garydgregory how can I indicate that it is a backwards incompatible change ? To be included in the next major release. I think the master branch is exactly for it', "You don't indicate anything, and you don't turn off JApiCmd as JApiCmd will fail the build if the PR breaks BC.", '@garydgregory I did not quite catch you. Do you mean that I need to provide a PR which breaks the build ? ']
Review Messages:
["Hi @asomov , thanks for the PR.

I've enabled the workflow to see what's the status of the build.

I haven't followed much of the development in these Java YAML libraries, but this task would require a JIRA issue too so that others can comment here/there, and also for the changelog. Could you create one, please?

And since it changes the public API, I believe we would have to assign it to a major release.

If you have more updates to this PR, please push your changes to the same branch so this PR is updated, instead of closing and creating new PR's, since that means someone will have to allow the workflow to run (as it's your first contribution to this repository - GitHub Actions security) and also since the previous comments and reviews would be discarded when this PR is closed.

Thank you!
Bruno", 'See comment.', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'I am marking this as -1 and "request change" in GH to fix BC checking. We cannot keep this PR open as a green build PR in case it gets merged by accident. It can stay open with a failing build.']

Title: CONFIGURATION-817: update to JUnit 5
Comment Messages:
['Can you explain the need for this change in more detail? Was this test not working before?', "After my changes the one test that used this method failed. I couldn't find out why my changes would have caused this, so I ran the tests on master again; the test failed there as well.

I started debugging the code, and noticed that the last modified timestamp wasn't changed. This is commented in FileUtils: https://github.com/apache/commons-io/blob/rel/commons-io-2.11.0/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/io/FileUtils.java#L849 (the first part of my comment comes from that line). The test clearly needed the last modified timestamp to change, something that was probably done automatically on Linux but on Windows it needed this extra step.", 'This gives us two separate mocking frameworks in the tests: Mockito and Easymock. Can we standardize on Mockito and remove Easymock?', 'Weird. I wonder how we missed that before.', "I think I can do that as separate PR, it's a bit too much work right now, especially since I'm already working on removing assertion messages (as requested in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONFIGURATION-817).

I tried using EasyMock as replacement of mockobjects first just to prevent a second mocking framework, but as far as I can tell EasyMock requires every call to be specified in order up front, whereas mockobjects and Mockito can be setup in any order (as long as the matchers are used correctly). I got so many errors that I gave up.", "Perhaps the tests aren't run on Windows?", "FYI, I'm already working on replacing EasyMock.", "And FYI, I've just pushed a commit that replaces EasyMock with Mockito."]
Review Messages: ['This looks good! I just have the one question on the file timestamp thing.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', "Thanks for all of this work, @robtimus! This looks great! I'll leave this open for a couple more days to see if anyone has any comments and then merge it."]

Title: Make default interpolation prefix lookups configurable
[CONFIGURATION-813]: Support both javax and jakarta namespace in mailapi
Comment Messages:
['Maybe rename the other constant to have a JAVAX postfix?', 'Reuse the constant you created above.', 'Another magic string, reuse the constant...', 'So this WILL cause a class cast exception? How is that ok?', 'Good idea. See #188 ', 'This entire method was actually not needed anymore. There is no longer any reason to not instantiate `InternetAddress` directly. ', 'This can simply be a direct class reference.', "Good point. I suppose the scenario might be like this:
- A user has both mailapi version on the classpath.
- They call `convert` passing in the javax InternetAddress class. 
- The converter sees that some type of InternetAddress has been requested and attempts to load the jakarta version, which is found.
- A new jakarta InternetAddress is returned, which causes a class cast exception when being assigned to the javax InternetAddress variable.

I've provided a fix for this in #188, where we only attempt to load and cast to the actual type given. Let me know what you think."]
